results.content: I would like more explanation as to why some of the syntax changes are made. Why does something become an object? Why do we use "this" and when is it appropriate. Beginners may not track well.

results.content: The content and style of teaching are great. I would suggest for the next course to focus the camera on code so it would be easy to read and see the code. The current course does not have that.

results.content: I thoroughly enjoyed the learning process and building the projects using hands-on instructions.  I would definitely take another course from Tyler in the future.  Thank you very much, Tyler.

results.content: Great course. Lots of great info on React and Bootstrap.

results.content: Took this to learn React using Amplify. Went over extremely basic React lessons and briefly mentioned how to set up amplify at the end. On top of that he used Amplify to set up a server? The whole entire point of amplify is using AWS serverless services, why you would use Amplify to set up a server I do not know, but I can't find a refund button so heres the review.

response.content:
Hey Matt! Sorry to hear the class did not align with your expectations. I'll aim to create a more in depth AWS Amplify course in the first quarter of 2020 and be sure you get it for free. 

One note - the AWS Amplify deployment is actually not setting up a server. It's an s3 bucket that serves your web app. You can then add other serverless functions like lambda to interact with. More to come in the next class!
response.content_html:
Hey Matt! Sorry to hear the class did not align with your expectations. I'll aim to create a more in depth AWS Amplify course in the first quarter of 2020 and be sure you get it for free.

One note - the AWS Amplify deployment is actually not setting up a server. It's an s3 bucket that serves your web app. You can then add other serverless functions like lambda to interact with. More to come in the next class!

results.content_html: Took this to learn React using Amplify. Went over extremely basic React lessons and briefly mentioned how to set up amplify at the end. On top of that he used Amplify to set up a server? The whole entire point of amplify is using AWS serverless services, why you would use Amplify to set up a server I do not know, but I can't find a refund button so heres the review.
